intro: Chromolaena borinquensis, commonly known as the Borinquen shrub, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and surrounded by pale green bracts, and it produces small, oval fruits. Chromolaena borinquensis is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in various soil types.
